definitions.definition: twice the size, amount, price, etc., or consisting of two similar things together:
examples: I ordered a double espresso (= two standard amounts in one cup).

definitions.definition: A double flower or plant is a flower with more than the usual number of petals:
a person who looks exactly the same as someone else:
examples: Hey, Tony, I met someone at a party last week who was your double.

definitions.definition: to become twice as much or as many, or to make something twice as much or many:
examples: The government aims to double the number of students in higher education within 25 years.

definitions.definition: something that is twice the amount, size, strength, etc. of something else:
examples: I paid double (= twice as much) for those trousers last week.
Fold the blanket double (= so that it is in two layers) and then you won't be cold.

definitions.definition: to have a problem with your eyes so that you see two of everything, usually because you are drunk or ill:
examples: I started seeing double, then I fainted.
